---
title: "R Notebook"
output: html_notebook
---
<!-- LIST -->
```{r}
x = list(1, "abc", TRUE, 3)  # === list(c(1), c("abc"), c(TRUE), c(3))
                             # every element in a list is actually a vector
x
```
```{r}
list(c(1), c("abc"), c(TRUE), c(3))
```
```{r}
class(x[[2]])
```
<!-- Apply function to a list: lapply -->
```{r}
types_x <- lapply(x, class)  # apply a class function to every element in list x
                             # and return to a new list
types_x
```
<!-- as.list() -->
```{r}
as.list(1:3)
```
<!-- list with many types of datasets, access by name -->
```{r}
xlist <- list(a="test1", b=1:3, data=head(iris))  # a, b and data are names
xlist
```
```{r}
xlist$b   # access to "b" name of xlist by $ sign
```
```{r}
xlist[["b"]]  # access to "b" name of xlist by [[]]
```
